rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/uk-japan-symposium-disasters"> <title>UK Japan Symposium on Disasters</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/uk-japan-symposium-disasters</link> <description>                                                 This symposium is one of the events marking the 150th anniversary year of the arrival at University College London of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdChoshu 5\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, the first citizens of Japan to travel abroad for a university education. It occurs on the same day as the signing of the formal Memorandum of Understanding between UCL and Tohoku University, regarding research collaboration in a number of areas including that of Disaster Science for which the lead institutes in the two universities are, respectively, the International Research Institute of Disaster Science (IRIDeS) of Tohoku University and the Institute for Risk and Disaster Reduction (IRDR) of UCL. The IRIDeS was established in the aftermath of the March 11th, 2011 giant earthquake and tsunami that impacted the coasts of NE Japan. Like IRDR, IRIDeS is a multi-disciplinary centre dealing with all aspects of natural hazards, disasters and disaster mitigation. This symposium and related activities on the following two days will therefore cover all aspects of disaster science, but with an emphasis upon earthquake and tsunami hazards and the implications for disaster mitigation science, engineering and management disciplines of the major tsunami disasters of recent years. <br /></description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Rosanna Smith</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-09-18T13:30:18Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Chancellors Hall, Senate House, Malet Street, London, WC1E 7HU</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-11-21T09:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-11-21T17:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/2013-11-19"> <title>UCL Lunch Hour Public Lecture: After Fukushima</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/2013-11-19</link> <enclosure url="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/images/events/2013-archive/Fukushima_plant_lo_res.jpeg" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>The Japanese islands face an extraordinary range of natural hazards \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, tsunami, lahars and tropical cyclones.</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Michael Kaminski</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-11-12T13:12:32Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Darwin Lecture Theatre access via Malet Place </silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-11-19T13:15:00Z</silvanews:startdt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/uk-japan-disaster-risk-reduction-workshop"> <title>UK Japan Disaster Risk Reduction Workshop</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/uk-japan-disaster-risk-reduction-workshop</link> <description>                                                                               This workshop is for academics and researchers from the UK and Japan, primarily from UCL and Tohoku University respectively but including their collaborators and others from academia and commerce, to present their recent and ongoing research in the linked fields of Disaster Science and Disaster Risk Reduction. The aims of the workshop will be to, firstly, increase knowledge and understanding of their respective activities, and secondly to provide a basis for discussion and development of future research collaborations between the UK and Japan in these research fields. Accordingly, the sessions of the workshop will feature a balance of presentations between UK-based and Japan-based researchers. Furthermore, each session will link areas of disaster science directly with their corresponding areas of disaster risk reduction research, in order to foster research activities into natural hazards and the physical processes of disaster events that lead directly to improvements in disaster risk reduction technologies and policies. </description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Amy L Chadderton</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-09-18T14:13:16Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Room B17, 1-19 Torrington Place, University College London</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-11-22T09:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-11-22T20:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/ucl_tohoku_disaster_risk_reduction_workshop"> <title>UCL-Tohoku Disaster Risk Reduction Workshop</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/ucl_tohoku_disaster_risk_reduction_workshop</link> <description>                          *INVITE ONLY*</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Amy L Chadderton</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-09-30T17:25:58Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Council Room, University College London</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-11-23T10:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-11-23T13:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/building-resilience-forum"> <title>IRDR Building Resilience Forum</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/building-resilience-forum</link> <description>Our first Forum this academic year is the <em>IRDR Building Resilience Forum</em> on Tuesday 5<sup>th</sup> November at 3.00pm convened by <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/people/joanna-faure-walker" target="_self">Dr Joanna Faure Walker</a>. The forum will take the form of presentations by keynote speakers and an open discussion bringing people together from disciplines including earth sciences, engineering, social sciences and statistics in order to discuss potential research ideas and collaborations for the topic of how to build  resilience. Attendance at this forum is by invitation only. For further information please contact Joanna: j.faure-walker@ucl.ac.uk.</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Rosanna Smith</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-10-15T11:11:48Z</dc:date> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/debating-matters-qual-2013"> <title>Debating Matters Qualifying Round 2013-2014</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/debating-matters-qual-2013</link> <description>    \ufffd\ufffdAfter succesfully hosting part of the Debating Matters National Finals in June 2013, the IRDR will now host regional qualifying rounds for the 2013-2014 competition.</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Rosanna Smith</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-10-15T09:32:56Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre, North Cloisters, and 16 Taviton St.</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-10-21T15:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-10-23T20:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/alexander-inaugural"> <title>Professor David Alexander Inaugural Lecture</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/alexander-inaugural</link> <enclosure url="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/people/prof-david-alexander" length="123456789" type="image/jpeg" /> <description>Professor David Alexander, Professor of Risk and Disaster Reduction in the UCL Institute for Risk and Disaster Reduction, will give his inaugural lecture on Monday 7th October 2013.</description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Rosanna Smith</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-09-02T13:23:18Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-10-07T16:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-10-07T17:00:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/debating-matters"> <title>Debating Matters National Final</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/debating-matters</link> <description>  \ufffd\ufffdThis year, the UCL Institute for Risk and Disaster Reduction will host the National final of Debating Matters. Debating Matters is a national debate competition for 6th form students, run by the Institute of Ideas. The National final runs over 3 days, with days 1 and 2, Fri 27th and Sat 28th June, hosted by the IRDR and day 3, Sun 29th June, hosted by the ROyal Society of Medicine.<br /></description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Rosanna Smith</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-06-19T17:00:25Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Anatomy building (28th June) and Roberts Building (29th June)</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-06-28T12:30:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-06-29T18:15:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/irdr-3rd-annual-conference"> <title>IRDR 3rd Annual Conference, 14th June 2013</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/irdr-3rd-annual-conference</link> <description>                                                                                              After successful annual  conferences in 2011 and 2012, we are hoping for our 2013 annual  conference to be even bigger and better. As in previous years, this   conference aims to draw together a varied and          dynamic  audience   from across UCL and beyond to report on, explore and           inform   research in risk and disaster reduction through             thought-provoking lectures and discussions. </description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Sonja Van Praag (WAMS)</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-03-26T12:25:50Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-06-14T08:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> <silvanews:enddt>2013-06-14T18:30:00Z</silvanews:enddt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/first"> <title>First Academic Conference on Risk and Disaster Risk Reduction and Resilience</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/first</link> <description>         UCL Institute for Risk and Disaster Reduction (IRDR) will hold a one-day event on 13 June 2013 in order to bring together representatives of the universities in the UK and Europe that offer courses or conduct research on risks, hazards, disasters and resilience. </description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Sonja Van Praag (WAMS)</dc:creator> <dc:date>2013-02-06T13:28:52Z</dc:date> <silvanews:location>UCL Gustave Tuck Lecture Theatre</silvanews:location> <silvanews:startdt>2013-06-13T08:00:00Z</silvanews:startdt> </item> <item rdf:about="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/irdr-seminars"> <title>IRDR 2012-2013 Seminar series\ufffd\ufffd</title> <link>https://www.ucl.ac.uk/rdr/events-news-publication/irdr-seminars</link> <description>   <strong>Convened by Dr Megan French</strong></description> <dc:subject></dc:subject> <dc:creator>Rosanna Smith</dc:creator> <dc:date>2012-09-05T13:33:53Z</dc:date> </item> </rdf:RDF>
